1.title: Robotics or Manned Missions for Under-Sea Work?
1.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, weighs the pros and cons of using robotics as a means of marine exploration.

2.title: Fresh Water Vs Salt Water Wrecks
2.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, compares the state of shipwrecks found in salt water as opposed to fresh water.

3.title: Inspiring the Next Generation
3.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, takes us aboard Project Shiphunt, where a group of high school students are introduced to the intricacies of shipwreck exploration.

4.title: N.O.A.A.'s Sanctuaries
4.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, takes an in/depth look at NOAA's Marine Sanctuaries, and the treasures that can be found there.

5.title: S.S. Tennessee
5.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, tells the story of the steamship Tennessee, which left its bones on the shores of Golden Gate National Parks.

6.title: The Value of Shipwrecks
6.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, looks at the riches that can be gleamed from exploring shipwrecks.

7.title: Thunder Bay Marine Sanctuary
7.plot: Dan Basta, NOAA's Director of Marine Sanctuaries, describes the Thunder Bay Marine Sanctuary, found in the Great Lakes, which houses close to 200 shipwrecks.

8.title: Underwater Archaeology Technology
8.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, takes a look at the impact that new and emerging technologies are having on the world of marine archaeology.

9.title: U.S.S. Arizona
9.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, revisits the USS Arizona, a World War II battleship sunk during the attack on Pearl Harbor. Learn more about its impact on history, as well as its current state as a Pacific National Monument.

10.title: U.S.S. Monitor
10.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, explores the rich history of the USS Monitor, the first ironclad warship used by the Union Navy during the Civil War.

11.title: What Was the First Marine Sanctuary?
11.plot: Dan Basta, NOAA's Director of Marine Sanctuaries, delves into the first Marine Sanctuary, the USS Monitor. Learn more about the history of this ironclad warship.

12.title: Marine Archaeology
12.plot: James Delgado, Director of the Maritime Heritage Program at NOAA, explores the biggest museum on Earth, our oceans.

13.title: Who Runs the Marine Sanctuaries?
13.plot: Dan Basta, NOAA's Director of Marine Sanctuaries, reviews the link between Marine Sanctuaries and the communities they encompass.

imdb.title: Curious Minds: Marine Archaeology
plot: Curious Minds interviews historians and political experts to contextualize important moments in history from little known facts about George Washington to life lessons from 9/11.
